page.title: 05Farming-Gleadless & Norton
page.content: First we went to Spittlehouse Farm and found out that it is not a farm anymore-it is a food catering firm! Mr.Priestly gave us information about how he runs it.He also told us that another farmer called Mr.Rose had bought some acres from him.We went to a small holding called Wetlands which is owned by a woman.She said she had been farming for 37 years.We also visited Grange Farm and talked to the owner.He said that he enjoyed working in agriculture.His farm was mixed,with both arable and dairy farming.He grows barley,potatoes and turnips, and keeps a Freisian and Jersey herd.He also has 40 ewes and 60 lambs.The farm has 156 acres.
